page.title: 16MOTORWAY PART TWO
page.content: 2. HOW MANY VEHICLES STILL TRAVELLED THROUGH HELSBY. 3.CONSIDER THE CONSEQUENCES OF THE TOTAL VOLUME OF TRAFFIC ON A56 PASSING THROUGH HELSBY IF THE M56 HAD NOT BEEN BUILT. THE TRAFFIC SURVEY OF THE MOTORWAY TOOK PLACE ON MONDAY 8TH JULY BETWEEN 11.2O AND 11.3O A.M. DURING THAT TIME 593 VEHICLES INCLUDING MANY ENORMOUS LORRIES PASSED EAST AND WEST. ON THURSDAY 11TH JULY AT THE SAME TIME A SIMILAR SURVEY WAS DONE FOR TRAFFIC TRAVELLING ALONG THE A56 DURING THIS PERIOD 96 VEHICLES PASSED BY. IT WAS QUITE CLEAR FROM THIS SURVEY THAT THE VAST MAJORITY OF TRAFFIC HAS NOW BEEN TAKEN OFF THE A56 BUT THAT THERE IS STILL QUITE A LOT OF LOCAL TRAFFIC. THE THOUGHT OF ALL THIS TRAFFIC PASSING THROUGH HELSBY IS FRIGHTENING
